gurmukhi: DMin DMin Dn ko BwKIAY jw kw jgqu gulwmu ]
transliteration: Dhann(i) Dhann(i) Dhan Ko Bhaakhooai Jaa Kaa Jagad(u) Gulam(u)||
translation: The mammon may hailed, who hath the whole world as her slave.

gurmukhi: sB inrKq Xw kO iPrY sB cl krq slwm ]35]
transliteration: Sabh Nirakhat Yaa Kau Phirai Sabh Chal Karat Salaam||35||
translation: All the world goes in search for her and all go to salute her.35.

gurmukhi: kwl n koaU krn sumwrw ] bYr bwd AhMkwr pswrw ]
transliteration: Kaal Na Ko( i)  Karan Soumaaraa|| Bair Baad Ahankaar Pasaaraa||
translation: None could remember KAL and there was only extension of enmity, strife ego.

gurmukhi: loB mUl ieih jg ko hUAw ] jw so cwhq sBY ko sUAw ]36]
transliteration: Lobh Moond Eh(i) Jag Ko Hooaa|| Jaa So Chaahat Sabhai Ko Moond||36||
translation: Only greed become the base of the world, because of which everyone wants the other to die.36.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy suB bMs brnnM nwm duqIAw iDAwie smwpq msqu suB msqu ]2] APjU ]137]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatak Granthe Soubh Bans Barnanan Naam Doutooaa Dhiaae Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||2||afjoo||137||
translation: End of the Second Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled ‘The Description of Ancestry’.2.

gurmukhi: rcw bYr bwdM ibDwqy ApwrM ] ijsY swD swikE n koaU suDwrM ]
transliteration: Rachaa Bair Baadan Bidhaate Apaaran|| Jisai Saadh Saakio Na Ko( i)  Sudhaaran||
translation: The Providence created the great vices of enmity and strife, which could not be controlled by any reformer.

gurmukhi: blI kwmrwXM mhw loB mohM ] gXo kaun bIrM su Xw qy AlohM ]1]
transliteration: Badoo Kaamraayan Mahaa Lobh Mohan|| Gado Kaoun Booran Su Yaa Te Alohan||1||
translation: Which warrior could save himself from the blwos of mighty king lust and the great courtiers creed and attachment? 1.

gurmukhi: qhwN bIr bMky bkY Awp m`DM ] auTy ssqR lY lY mcw ju`D su`DM ]
transliteration: Tahaan Boor Banke Bakaoo Aap Maddhan|| Outhe Sastra Lai Lai Machaa Juddh Suddhan||
translation: There the youthful warriors are busy challenging shuts amongst themselves, they stand up with their weapons and are engaged in tough fight.

gurmukhi: kwhUM K`prI Kol KMfy ApwrM ] ncy bIr bYqwl faurU fkwrM ]2]
transliteration: Kaahoon Khapproo Dhol Khande Apaaran|| Nache Boor Baitaal Dauroo Dakaaran||2
translation: In this fight, somewhere there are innumerable shafts, helmets and double-edged swords in use. The evil spirits and ghosts are dancing and the tabors are resounding.2.

gurmukhi: khUM eIs sIsM puAY ruMf mwlM ] khUM fwk faurU khUM kMibqwnM ]
transliteration: Kahoon Oos Soosan Puai Round Maalan|| Kahoon Daak Dauroo Kahoon Kanbitaalan||
translation: Somewhere the god Shiva is stringing the skulls in his rosary of skulls, somewhere the vampires and ghosts are shrieking joyfully.
